title: Fix CLI scaffold missing component files
description:
## CLI Scaffold Missing Component Files

**Test:** `@proofkit/cli` > `browser-apps.test.ts` > 'should create a project with FileMaker integration in CI mode'

**Reproduced locally:** Yes (after deleting stale `packages/tmp/cli-tests/test-fm-project`)

### Missing 3 components:
1. `src/components/mode-toggle.tsx` - imported by `slot-header-right.tsx:4`
2. `src/components/ui/sonner.tsx` - imported by `providers.tsx:4`
3. `src/components/ui/button.tsx` - imported by `page.tsx:11`

### Root cause:
CLI scaffolding generates code that imports these shadcn/ui-style components but doesn't include the actual component files in the generated project.

### Why it appeared to pass locally before:
Stale `test-fm-project` dir existed from previous runs. Turbo may have cached 'passed' result based on old inputs. Fresh scaffold exposes the missing files.

### Fix needed:
Ensure CLI registry/templates include all required UI components that generated code imports. Check:
- `packages/registry/` for component definitions
- CLI scaffold logic that copies/generates components

### Additional warnings (non-blocking):
```
Warning: Invalid input options - For the "define". Invalid key: Expected never but received "define".
```
This vitest config warning appears twice but doesn't cause failure.
close_reason: Fixed by including shadcn components directly in template instead of fetching at runtime

title: Separate unit and E2E tests
description:
Separate tests that require real FileMaker server from unit tests that use mocks. Run only mock-based tests in CI.

Goals:
- CI runs only mock-based tests (no server dependency)
- E2E tests remain runnable locally via pnpm test:e2e
- No code coverage loss - mock all tested functionality
- Follow fmodata's capture pattern for other packages

See plan file: ~/.claude/plans/elegant-orbiting-robin.md
close_reason: Closed
